page.title: 04Farming:beef at Cradley Hall
page.content: 150 beef{cattle}and 200{sheep}are fattened for slaughter each year. Unlike most of the farms in this area the stock are not reared on the farm itsself and the farmer does not use local markets all the time. He owns his own flat bed bulker and his own haulage equipment. He buys most of his{cattle}from Yeovil market in Somerset and He sends some weekly for slaughter at Cinderford abattoir in the Forest of Dean. Lambs are bought in the autumn and sold at springtime. {Cattle}are fed on{silage}during the winter but are let out in the spring. The usual{rotation of crops}is 2 years of winter whear, 1 year of barley and 2-3 years of ley. About half the fields are ley and half pasture.
